text:
Ethel is a town in Attala County, Mississippi. The population was 418 at the 2010 census.
History.
Ethel is named for the daughter of Capt. S. B. McConnico.
The mayor of Ethel is Ophelia Mitchell.
Geography.
Ethel is located at (33.123524, -89.465275), along the Yockanookany River.
According to the United States Census Bureau, the town has a total area of, all land.
Education.
The town of Ethel is served by the Attala County School District.
